[{'created': '2019-02-25 08:56:45.000000000', 'message': 'Update alloc-candidates-in-tree

"Filter Allocation Candidates by Provider Tree" spec has been approved
proposing the new "in_tree" queryparm, but it didn't address how it
works with the granular requests using "in_tree<N>" syntax.

This patch updates the spec to clear it out.

Change-Id: I2726b1b1a632ef3627af872c150ed6564e65b108
Blueprint: alloc-candidates-in-tree
'}]
commit_message:
Update alloc-candidates-in-tree

"Filter Allocation Candidates by Provider Tree" spec has been approved
proposing the new "in_tree" queryparm, but it didn't address how it
works with the granular requests using "in_tree<N>" syntax.

This patch updates the spec to clear it out.

Change-Id: I2726b1b1a632ef3627af872c150ed6564e65b108
Blueprint: alloc-candidates-in-tree

commit_message:
exc_filters: fix deadlock detection for MariaDB/Galera cluster

MariasDB/Galera cluster server produces an error like:

(1213, u'Deadlock: wsrep aborted transaction')

which is currently not detected properly and, thus, not retried.

Change-Id: Ifb4a81d50e490e734e12986e51efd6bd3c339c31
Signed-off-by: Pierre-Samuel Le Stang <pierre-samuel.le-stang@corp.ovh.com>
(cherry picked from commit ae227eb3b9adb430cf6aa5a4f46f846e964fff91)

[{'created': '2019-03-08 18:45:46.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Neutron precheck to not fail with newer Docker

With newer Docker versions `systemctl show docker` returns:

  MountFlags=shared

Instead of:

  MountFlags=1048576

This fix accepts either value as valid to ensure the check is not
erroneously failing.

Closes-Bug #1791365

Change-Id: I2bd626466d6a0e189e0d85877b2be8f2b4bb37f4
'}, {'created': '2019-03-11 11:16:08.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Neutron precheck to not fail with newer Docker

With newer Docker versions `systemctl show docker` returns:

  MountFlags=shared

Instead of:

  MountFlags=1048576

This fix accepts either value as valid to ensure the check is not

Change-Id: I2bd626466d6a0e189e0d85877b2be8f2b4bb37f4

commit_message:
Fix Neutron precheck to not fail with newer Docker

With newer Docker versions `systemctl show docker` returns:

  MountFlags=shared

Instead of:

  MountFlags=1048576

This fix accepts either value as valid to ensure the check is not
erroneously failing.

Closes-Bug: #1791365

Change-Id: I2bd626466d6a0e189e0d85877b2be8f2b4bb37f4

commit_message:
Adding barbican on skip list of featureset020

python-tempestconf doesn't have support to barbican plugin yet, and the
plugin set barbican to enabled by default, making the tests fails and so
the job, since featureset020 doesn't have barbican enabled

https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/892?kanban-status=1447275

Closes-Bug: 1821330
Change-Id: Ib1f8180b7769852daa16565fbbe3cd1d64afe3d4

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-11 11:21:03.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Publish LOCI images

Currently the OpenStack images are not published on dockerhub in
openstackhelm namespace.

This makes use of the standard openstack infra roles as much as
we can, to build and promote images.

The only thing that differs is the creation of the requirements
image, which needs to be available before building
the other images. For this, we:
1) Build the requirements container using infra role.
2) Build and run our own docker webserver container, extracting
   the wheels from the requirements container.

Change-Id: I16fc6e989f1c412d458270195c6aff8343524c48

commit_message:
Publish LOCI images

Currently the OpenStack images are not published on dockerhub in
openstackhelm namespace.

This makes use of the standard openstack infra roles as much as
we can, to build and promote images.

The only thing that differs is the creation of the requirements
image, which needs to be available before building
the other images. For this, we:
1) Build the requirements container using infra role.
2) Build and run our own docker webserver container, extracting
   the wheels from the requirements container.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/640711/

Change-Id: I16fc6e989f1c412d458270195c6aff8343524c48

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I585b2aa33919472c66a10577866511ed07188f06

commit_message:
Implement domain admin functionality for user API

This commit add explicit testing to show how users with the admin role
on a domain can manage users within thier domain. It also modifies the
default policies to account for this functionality. A subsequent patch
will do the same for project users.

Change-Id: I3899e07b857e213f85384ed9c9e4add199290a49
Partial-Bug: 1748027
Partial-Bug: 968696

[{'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2019-01-28 12:34:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2019-01-28 12:54:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-01-28 13:38:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/633493/2 : FAILURE in 42m 15s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-01-31 20:02:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Why is this change made on stable/queens only? If this problem exists on master, you should propose the fix to master (with a test) and then we can work on backports via the stable branch maintenance guide:

https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#processes'}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2019-02-01 15:15:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Matt
> Why is this change made on stable/queens only?
It's because Queens is what I'm testing with, and where I've been able to confirm that this patch is an effective workaround for the problem described in https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1809123.  I've posted this as a helpful comment for that bug report."}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2019-02-01 15:18:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

BTW, Matt, I wonder if you might be able to answer the question that I asked in the bug (and Tim echoed): "The biggest thing that I don't understand about this is: why aren't there loads of OpenStack users hitting this all the time? Do most OpenStack deployment using Queens or later not use NFS for instance ephemeral storage? If not, is that because they don't care about live migration, or because they're getting that some other way?"  I guess you'd be very well placed for that!'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-02-21 17:04:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I don't know of many users that are using NFS for compute node ephemeral storage (local disk). I think that for most users using local shared disk for their computes, they would be using Ceph."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-02-21 17:14:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm still -1 on this because if we're going to fix a bug that is present on newer branches, we need to start at the latest branch that has the issue and fix it there (which would be master, hence https://review.openstack.org/#/c/625741/) and then backport in order, otherwise you could fix this in queens and then upgrade to rocky or stein and you're now regressed."}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2019-03-01 21:10:15.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning this in favour of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/625741/2'}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2019-03-05 15:29:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Neil, would you mind un-abandoning this change and moving it to master? I think this is the way to go here.'}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2019-03-06 10:50:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Matthew - OK, will do.  I'm concerned, though, that I don't have capability to do similar system testing (additional to Zuul CI) on master that I have been able to do with Queens."}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2019-03-06 10:50:35.000000000', 'content': 'Restored

Restoring for move to master...'}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2019-03-06 10:55:43.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Ah, looks like an existing Gerrit change can't move to another branch.  Instead Gerrit has created a new change for master at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/641315/, and I'll abandon this one again."}, {'account_id': 16771, 'date': '2019-03-07 10:51:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Let's restore this patch and merge it instead of https://review.openstack.org/625741"}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2019-03-07 10:55:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Michael - Yes, I've done that; please see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/641315/"}, {'account_id': 16771, 'date': '2019-03-07 11:06:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-28 12:34:14.000000000', 'message': "Allow utime call to fail on Flat image base file

This utime call sometimes fails, with Permission Denied, when the base
file is on an NFS client filesystem.  I don't understand why, but wonder
if it's a similar problem as the one that motivated using touch instead
of utime in ec9d5e375e2.  In any case, IIUC, timing isn't the primary
thing that the image cache manager uses to determine when the base file
is in use.  The primary mechanism for that is whether there is a
matching disk file for a current instance.  The timestamp on the base
file is only used when deciding whether to delete a base file that is
_not_ in use; so it is not a big deal if that deletion happens slightly
earlier, for an unused base file, because of one of these preceding
utime calls having failed.

Change-Id: Idc131ff426f1707150867030fa5a69b77a7fc832
"}, {'created': '2019-01-28 12:54:48.000000000', 'message': "Allow utime call to fail on Flat image base file

This utime call sometimes fails, with Permission Denied, when the base
file is on an NFS client filesystem.  I don't understand why, but wonder
if it's a similar problem as the one that motivated using touch instead
of utime in ec9d5e375e2.  In any case, IIUC, timing isn't the primary
thing that the image cache manager uses to determine when the base file
is in use.  The primary mechanism for that is whether there is a
matching disk file for a current instance.  The timestamp on the base
file is only used when deciding whether to delete a base file that is
_not_ in use; so it is not a big deal if that deletion happens slightly
earlier, for an unused base file, because of one of these preceding
utime calls having failed.

Note: this relates to https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1809123 and
is a possible alternate fix to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/625741/.

Change-Id: Idc131ff426f1707150867030fa5a69b77a7fc832
"}, {'created': '2019-03-13 12:24:44.000000000', 'message': "Allow utime call to fail on qcow2 image base file

This utime call sometimes fails, with EACCES (Permission Denied), when
the base file is on an NFS client filesystem.  I don't understand why,
but wonder if it's a similar problem as the one that motivated using
touch instead of utime in ec9d5e375e2.  In any case, IIUC, timing
isn't the primary thing that the image cache manager uses to determine
when the base file is in use.  The primary mechanism for that is
whether there is a matching disk file for a current instance.  The
timestamp on the base file is only used when deciding whether to
delete a base file that is _not_ in use; so it is not a big deal if
that deletion happens slightly earlier, for an unused base file,
because of one of these preceding utime calls having failed.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_imagebackend.py

NOTE(mriedem): Conflict is due to not having change
I154b1ef14dbace803841cb3eed3ff02dd0020588 in Queens.

Closes-Bug: #1809123
Co-Authored-By: Matthew Booth <mbooth@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Idc131ff426f1707150867030fa5a69b77a7fc832
(cherry picked from commit 362bba9011f8445285c3f72a0b00630163bfbc2f)
(cherry picked from commit 7d0dd625d35a08d159b50154809a53e8444ae25c)
"}]
commit_message:
Allow utime call to fail on qcow2 image base file

This utime call sometimes fails, with EACCES (Permission Denied), when
the base file is on an NFS client filesystem.  I don't understand why,
but wonder if it's a similar problem as the one that motivated using
touch instead of utime in ec9d5e375e2.  In any case, IIUC, timing
isn't the primary thing that the image cache manager uses to determine
when the base file is in use.  The primary mechanism for that is
whether there is a matching disk file for a current instance.  The
timestamp on the base file is only used when deciding whether to
delete a base file that is _not_ in use; so it is not a big deal if
that deletion happens slightly earlier, for an unused base file,
because of one of these preceding utime calls having failed.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_imagebackend.py

NOTE(mriedem): Conflict is due to not having change
I154b1ef14dbace803841cb3eed3ff02dd0020588 in Queens.

Closes-Bug: #1809123
Co-Authored-By: Matthew Booth <mbooth@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Idc131ff426f1707150867030fa5a69b77a7fc832
(cherry picked from commit 362bba9011f8445285c3f72a0b00630163bfbc2f)
(cherry picked from commit 7d0dd625d35a08d159b50154809a53e8444ae25c)

commit_message:
Avoid BadRequest error log on volume attachment

At the gate, only AttachVolumeNegativeTest makes nova-api output
error log as a negative test case like:

  ERROR nova.volume.cinder [None req-dcc8814f-7439-44c8-872e-86ea51f4b319
   tempest-AttachVolumeNegativeTest-431575524
   tempest-AttachVolumeNegativeTest-431575524]
   [instance: ca526f93-e723-4372-a1c1-4fa03ffc1bd7]
   Create attachment failed for volume 0a6e6a92-f095-4ab7-803c-826934824418.
   Error: Invalid volume: Volume 0a6e6a92-f095-4ab7-803c-826934824418 status
     must be available or downloading (HTTP 400)
     (Request-ID: req-5e5074ea-cd12-43ed-9355-5db539ca9720)
   Code: 400:
   BadRequest: Invalid volume: Volume 0a6e6a92-f095-4ab7-803c-826934824418
     status must be available or downloading (HTTP 400)
     (Request-ID: req-5e5074ea-cd12-43ed-9355-5db539ca9720)

Operators don't need to take care of BadRequest cases in general because
that is due to end user mistakes. So this patch makes nova-api avoiding
such error log case.

Closes-Bug: #1797237

Change-Id: I22d9d974822282ffc3c0942d4766b135717dd369
(cherry picked from commit 5bef746c9b50537dde47278a208c4457b42896d0)
(cherry picked from commit 35a050a520683c104b8ba170cdca49ee0f9c9088)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-05 10:20:06.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Add workaround to cleanup instance dir when using rbd

At present all virt drivers provide a cleanup method that takes a single
destroy_disks boolean to indicate when the underlying storage of an
instance should be destroyed.

When cleaning up after an evacuation or revert resize the value of
destroy_disks is determined by the compute layer calling down both into
the check_instance_shared_storage_local method of the local virt driver
and remote check_instance_shared_storage method of the virt driver on
the host now running the instance.

For the Libvirt driver the initial local call will return None when
using the shared block RBD imagebackend as it is assumed all instance
storage is shared resulting in destroy_disks always being False when
cleaning up. This behaviour is wrong as the instance disks are stored
separately to the instance directory that still needs to be cleaned up
on the host. Additionally this directory could also be shared
independently of the disks on a NFS share for example and would need to
also be checked before removal.

This change introduces a backportable workaround configurable for the
Libvirt driver with which operators can ensure that the instance
directory is always removed during cleanup when using the RBD
imagebackend. When enabling this workaround operators will need to
ensure that the instance directories are not shared between computes.

Future work will allow for the removal of this workaround by separating
the shared storage checks from the compute to virt layers between the
actual instance disks and any additional storage required by the
specific virt backend.

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflicts due to If1b6e5f20d2ea82d94f5f0550f13189fc9bc16c4
not being present in stable/queens.

Conflicts:
        nova/conf/workarounds.py

Related-Bug: #1761062
Partial-Bug: #1414895
Change-Id: I8fd6b9f857a1c4919c3365951e2652d2d477df77
(cherry picked from commit d6c1f6a1032ed2ea99f3d8b70ccf38065163d785)
(cherry picked from commit 02ab9f11d8db4f03a845a480cbc8fa2e28bffc14)

'}, {'created': '2019-02-11 10:56:59.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Add workaround to cleanup instance dir when using rbd

At present all virt drivers provide a cleanup method that takes a single
destroy_disks boolean to indicate when the underlying storage of an
instance should be destroyed.

When cleaning up after an evacuation or revert resize the value of
destroy_disks is determined by the compute layer calling down both into
the check_instance_shared_storage_local method of the local virt driver
and remote check_instance_shared_storage method of the virt driver on
the host now running the instance.

For the Libvirt driver the initial local call will return None when
using the shared block RBD imagebackend as it is assumed all instance
storage is shared resulting in destroy_disks always being False when
cleaning up. This behaviour is wrong as the instance disks are stored
separately to the instance directory that still needs to be cleaned up
on the host. Additionally this directory could also be shared
independently of the disks on a NFS share for example and would need to
also be checked before removal.

This change introduces a backportable workaround configurable for the
Libvirt driver with which operators can ensure that the instance
directory is always removed during cleanup when using the RBD
imagebackend. When enabling this workaround operators will need to
ensure that the instance directories are not shared between computes.

Future work will allow for the removal of this workaround by separating
the shared storage checks from the compute to virt layers between the
actual instance disks and any additional storage required by the
specific virt backend.

commit_message:
libvirt: Add workaround to cleanup instance dir when using rbd

At present all virt drivers provide a cleanup method that takes a single
destroy_disks boolean to indicate when the underlying storage of an
instance should be destroyed.

When cleaning up after an evacuation or revert resize the value of
destroy_disks is determined by the compute layer calling down both into
the check_instance_shared_storage_local method of the local virt driver
and remote check_instance_shared_storage method of the virt driver on
the host now running the instance.

For the Libvirt driver the initial local call will return None when
using the shared block RBD imagebackend as it is assumed all instance
storage is shared resulting in destroy_disks always being False when
cleaning up. This behaviour is wrong as the instance disks are stored
separately to the instance directory that still needs to be cleaned up
on the host. Additionally this directory could also be shared
independently of the disks on a NFS share for example and would need to
also be checked before removal.

This change introduces a backportable workaround configurable for the
Libvirt driver with which operators can ensure that the instance
directory is always removed during cleanup when using the RBD
imagebackend. When enabling this workaround operators will need to
ensure that the instance directories are not shared between computes.

Future work will allow for the removal of this workaround by separating
the shared storage checks from the compute to virt layers between the
actual instance disks and any additional storage required by the
specific virt backend.

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflicts as If1b6e5f20d2ea82d94f5f0550f13189fc9bc16c4
only merged in Rocky and the backports of
Id3c74c019da29070811ffc368351e2238b3f6da5 and
I217fba9138132b107e9d62895d699d238392e761 have yet to land on
stable/queens from stable/rocky.

Conflicts:
        nova/conf/workarounds.py

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I6fdf0c67ab647dcbc87d71893613ed9d0ed2a6c0

commit_message:
Install git-core for openSUSE

openSUSE's git packaging follows more the Debian structure where
there is a split between git (which is *everything* under the planet)
and git-core (which is the git command that we want)

Change-Id: Ied223fb87b3965dad1171acb9e4ad72846fbd632

commit_message:
Replace usage of netloc filters to urlsplit

Removed references to netloc_no_port as it will be taken out from
openstack-ansible-plugins. Now using ansible 2.4's urlsplit filter
as a replacement.

Change-Id: If28c8bf2856ebb9a1cab4759b3ddc5b6c4685abf
Related-Bug: #1820830

commit_message:
Add requested_size to extend_volume

Nova has changed the interface of the compute driver
extend_volume method [1] adding a new parameter namely
requested_size. This patch updates the signature of the
PowerVMDriver extend_volume method to match the change.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/613039/

Change-Id: I9df280bba8eb663dbe631a741f8d6f728b3b8f87

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Change-Id: Ie9f277d54f856227d626ef298a9d867a0b3fa287
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Remove retag tripleo-ci-testing for periodic containers build job

As described in the bug the retag added at [1] isn't working.

However we are correctly pushing with the tripleo-ci-testing delorean
repo hash and that should be sufficient for the periodic jobs that
consume containers built by this job.

This removes the retag logic altogether and also removes the
push_tag variable. A related review in [2] also removes it in the
periodic jobs that were using this variable (no one else does/was)

Related-Bug: 1819583
[1] https://review.openstack.org/641348
[2] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/19484
Change-Id: I42f8e05bf1e5be230acdb7be16b056c8aff117f2

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I87122ec270f10999072c812e1177783b61372ba7

commit_message:
add an option to let the user choose the right time to start connection

Sometimes we don't want to start connection when the IDL is created,
because in some cases our resources may not be ready. so give users a
choice when to connect is better.

Change-Id: Iccf4c604127568719e4ebde60959f3b4ec04de58

[{'created': '2019-03-22 13:44:42.000000000', 'message': "Fix SoftwareDeployment on DELETE action

When we specify a sd on delete action, os-collect-config will not
get authentication because we didn't load access_allowed_handlers
after stack enter stack delete phrase. This patch will make sure
we load necessary access_allowed_handlers even if in stack delete
phrase.

Change-Id: I43c1a865f507f7cb7757e26ae5c503ce484ee280
Story: #2004661
Task: #28628
(cherry picked from commit 0e1ed1a4b23142ff379e01a3574fef771f703915)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix SoftwareDeployment on DELETE action

When we specify a sd on delete action, os-collect-config will not
get authentication because we didn't load access_allowed_handlers
after stack enter stack delete phrase. This patch will make sure
we load necessary access_allowed_handlers even if in stack delete
phrase.

Change-Id: I43c1a865f507f7cb7757e26ae5c503ce484ee280
Story: #2004661
Task: #28628
(cherry picked from commit 0e1ed1a4b23142ff379e01a3574fef771f703915)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-15 10:05:54.000000000', 'message': 'Add mock.patch.stopall cleanup handler to base test class

There are a few places where an object is mocked but never stopped.
Such a thing can cause unexpected behavior for other tests influeced by
the mock.  To be on the safe side, this patch adds a cleanup handler
that always stops all mocked objects after test is finished.

Change-Id: Iaf08484b6e74e482c7536a347fc476ca7cdc744a
'}]
commit_message:
Add mock.patch.stopall cleanup handler to base test class

There are a few places where an object is mocked but never stopped.
Such a thing can cause unexpected behavior for other tests influeced by
the mock.  To be on the safe side, this patch adds a cleanup handler
that always stops all mocked objects after test is finished.

Change-Id: Iaf08484b6e74e482c7536a347fc476ca7cdc744a

commit_message:
mariadb: stop requiring extra package mariadb-server-utils

mariadb 10.3 ships mysql_upgrade in mariadb-server-utils.
Since I1a450736721863b91be1ea3d3c8948990de9fdeb, mariadb
Kolla image includes that package by default in Stein, so we
no longer need to install it in tripleo's template override.

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I15d679b0f432c219d48b6e00bd0fe1cedd9620eb

Update master for stable/stein

subject: Avoid redundant compute node update
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}, {'_account_id': 14595, 'name': 'z Systems KVM', 'email': 'zkvm-ci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-zkvm-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16898, 'name': 'Virtuozzo CI', 'email': 'virtuozzo6-ci@virtuozzo.com', 'username': 'virtuozzo6-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16929, 'name': 'Giridhar Jayavelu', 'email': 'gjayavelu@vmware.com', 'username': 'gjayavelu'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23498, 'name': 'IBM zVM CI', 'email': 'zvmosci@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'zvmosci'}, {'_account_id': 26515, 'name': 'Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'nova_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'nova_hyperv_ci'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 16929, 'date': '2018-06-18 19:04:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16929, 'date': '2018-06-18 20:20:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-06-18 20:39:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-20232 : FAILURE in 1h 17m 40s'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-18 23:53:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

There appears to be one code path through _init_compute_node where we don't do an _update().  Not sure how/when it can get hit, or if that invalidates this whole patch.

Also not sure if any of the intervening stuff in _update_available_resource makes it necessary to *redo* _update() afterward.  Based on the test results... I would say so :)

Have you tried this out in a live environment and seen a significant performance boost from it?"}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-06-19 01:17:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with check hyper-v

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/576235/1/ : FAILURE in 3h 45m 32s'}, {'account_id': 16929, 'date': '2018-06-19 19:03:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

(1 comment)

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > There appears to be one code path through _init_compute_node where
 > we don't do an _update().  Not sure how/when it can get hit, or if
 > that invalidates this whole patch.
 > 
 > Also not sure if any of the intervening stuff in _update_available_resource
 > makes it necessary to *redo* _update() afterward.  Based on the
 > test results... I would say so :)
 > 
 > Have you tried this out in a live environment and seen a
 > significant performance boost from it?

Thanks for the review. Yes, I tried on live environment. The get_inventory() eventually invokes get_stats_from_cluster() in nova/virt/vmwareapi/vm_util.py, which takes ~1s. 
For every 60s (periodic task) there is additional call to vcenter and redundant processing.  This will cost more when we add pci devices since there is lot of data (200+ objects) devices retrieved from vcenter."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-08-27 18:20:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

This was solved by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/520024/'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-03-22 16:15:59.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This has been -W/-2 for a while. Please reopen if you feel there is still value here.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-18 19:04:33.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid redundant compute node update

_update_available_resource() in nova/compute/resource_tracker.py invokes
_init_compute_node() which internally calls _update() and once again _update()
is called at the end of _update_available_resource(). This patch removes
the extra _update() call.

Change-Id: I26ff1194708c8dcbdfc1bcfc857cda4caa9eec56
Fixes-Bug: #1777491
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid redundant compute node update

_update_available_resource() in nova/compute/resource_tracker.py invokes
_init_compute_node() which internally calls _update() and once again _update()
is called at the end of _update_available_resource(). This patch removes
the extra _update() call.

Change-Id: I26ff1194708c8dcbdfc1bcfc857cda4caa9eec56
Fixes-Bug: #1777491

commit_message:
Add verbosity level to the ansible update/upgrade run

The tripleo-common allow us to provide a verbosity level
but its not possible to pass it with the cli.
This review catch the --debug option passed to the cli
and provide it to package_update workflow

Manual Cherry pick from: Ib1fc8f6aab9a0b1a26945d441185b5c8ccb6e7dd

Change-Id: Ib1fc8f6aab9a0b1a26945d441185b5c8ccb6e7dd

messages:
[{'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2019-02-08 13:38:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2019-02-08 15:22:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2019-02-11 08:42:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2019-03-21 09:18:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2019-03-21 16:48:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 29503, 'date': '2019-03-22 15:50:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Hi Luka,

It is quite a relevant patch,

These new variables will permit developers to quickly configure aspects of CloudKitty and will be useful to them.

This update was also needed to reflect the v2 storage (with influxdb as default).

Change in aggregation method is pertinent and will prevent many headaches I'm sure."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-08 13:38:10.000000000', 'message': 'Update the devstack plugin

This updates various parts of the devstack plugin:

* The fetcher is now configurable via the "CLOUDKITTY_FETCHER" variable and
  defaults to gnocchi (this allows the user to have immediate results).

* The "CLOUDKITTY_SERVICES" variable was removed as it is not used anymore.

* The storage backend does now default to "influxdb". If this storage backend is
  selected, influxdb is installed. This can be done on fedora and ubuntu. The
  storage backend to use in devstack can be configured through the
  ``CLOUDKITTY_STORAGE_BACKEND`` and ``CLOUDKITTY_STORAGE_VERSION`` variables.

* Some details about available variables have been added to the devstack
  documentation. Since the "admin/quick_deployment" section did only contain
  the devstack documentation, it has been removed for now.

* Given that the "ceilometer-low" archive-policy (default in devstack) only
  provides the "mean" aggregation method, it is now the aggregation method
  used in the default metrics.yml file.

commit_message:
Update the devstack plugin

This updates various parts of the devstack plugin:

* The fetcher is now configurable via the "CLOUDKITTY_FETCHER" variable and
  defaults to gnocchi (this allows the user to have immediate results).

* The "CLOUDKITTY_SERVICES" variable was removed as it is not used anymore.

* The storage backend does now default to "influxdb". If this storage backend is
  selected, influxdb is installed. This can be done on fedora and ubuntu. The
  storage backend to use in devstack can be configured through the
  ``CLOUDKITTY_STORAGE_BACKEND`` and ``CLOUDKITTY_STORAGE_VERSION`` variables.

* Some details about available variables have been added to the devstack
  documentation. Since the "admin/quick_deployment" section did only contain
  the devstack documentation, it has been removed for now.

* Given that the "ceilometer-low" archive-policy (default in devstack) only
  provides the "mean" aggregation method, it is now the aggregation method
  used in the default metrics.yml file.

Change-Id: I37452772de163b5fafc502917af870c86a3d38b2

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-18 21:18:08.000000000', 'message': "Convert with_dict tasks to use loop and be less chatty

with_dict is replaced by ansible's loop:
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_loops.html#with-dict

This migrates tasks using with_dict over to use loop instead.

Additionally, when using loop (or with_dict), the entire loop item is
logged by default. This makes these tasks very verbose since we're
looping over large json/yaml files. Instead, use loop_control and label
ot only log the item key. The entire data structure already exists in
the config-download directory anyway, so there's no need to log the
whole thing to the console.

Conflicts:
    common/deploy-steps-tasks.yaml

Change-Id: I1fc7431dfc662212b6ca64f4f738760f25b0c30b
(cherry picked from commit 1b0c827930866538a8d1cae91f1c31bbd09b4199)
(cherry picked from commit 94df25e339368439d144c18142f50f442f219285)
"}]
commit_message:
Convert with_dict tasks to use loop and be less chatty

with_dict is replaced by ansible's loop:
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/user_guide/playbooks_loops.html#with-dict

This migrates tasks using with_dict over to use loop instead.

Additionally, when using loop (or with_dict), the entire loop item is
logged by default. This makes these tasks very verbose since we're
looping over large json/yaml files. Instead, use loop_control and label
ot only log the item key. The entire data structure already exists in
the config-download directory anyway, so there's no need to log the
whole thing to the console.

Conflicts:
    common/deploy-steps-tasks.yaml

Change-Id: I1fc7431dfc662212b6ca64f4f738760f25b0c30b
(cherry picked from commit 1b0c827930866538a8d1cae91f1c31bbd09b4199)
(cherry picked from commit 94df25e339368439d144c18142f50f442f219285)

commit_message:
Add service developer documentation for scopes

We have documentation on the various scopes keystone offers, but we
don't describe *how* other developers in OpenStack should use this
information.

This commit attempts to answer some of the most common authorization
scope questions we've heard and fixes up some wording to make the
document more clear.

Change-Id: Iaf53e632e1c4e7c2ef1fcbf0262d99d896c06157

(3 comments)

I think this change is now duplicated to the bp speed-up-neutron-bulk-creation. And I have some questions:
Since you give it a 1024 window, or it will be entire subnet range if CIDR is less that 1024, so what happend to a /27 /26 /25 /24 subnet CIDR ? does it have a better performance?

Such a 1024 range is not so much good for the cloud admin or user to estimate the IP usage, since the first IP addr can be 1.0.0.1, the next can be 1.0.0.255, right?'}, {'account_id': 13692, 'date': '2018-10-19 07:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2018-10-19 08:28:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

Thank you for comments :)

 > (3 comments)
 > 
 > I think this change is now duplicated to the bp speed-up-neutron-bulk-creation.
Its not only related to bulk-creation. If there are 20 customers and they're trying to create a port we could see a lot of race-conditions here. Its kind different from bulk creation.

 > And I have some questions:
 > Since you give it a 1024 window, or it will be entire subnet range
 > if CIDR is less that 1024, so what happend to a /27 /26 /25 /24
 > subnet CIDR ? does it have a better performance?
 > 

While converting IPSet to list for each candidate in L179 (because its kind of generator) the IPAddress object is created. We need to set a strict window, to not loose time for unnecessary object creation (for large subnets, like ipv6, it takes a lot of time...). The performance is getting worse after scaling up this window. So we need to set "some" value.
After tests we found that window=1024 prevent us from db duplication exceptions and also is enough fast. Please check related BUG when I added a comment how faster it is.
Of course if you have only some of free IPs there will always be a fight between threads (especially if the number of threads is pretty the same or bigger than number of free ips). 

 > Such a 1024 range is not so much good for the cloud admin or user
 > to estimate the IP usage, since the first IP addr can be 1.0.0.1,
 > the next can be 1.0.0.255, right?

For default prefer_next is not used, so there is no possibility to estimate usage nowadays. And also after a while the subnet is fragmented anyway, due some port is created and then removed.
If a set of clients are trying to allocate IPs its not even possible to make the allocation in order. It will basically end with a lot of duplications. The only solution is to make a lock_synchronized on _generate_ip() method to achieve that, but it will make the whole generation process slower (I verified that).'}, {'account_id': 13692, 'date': '2018-10-19 08:31:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-10-19 09:51:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2018-10-19 10:15:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 13692, 'date': '2018-10-19 10:19:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-10-19 10:33:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-10-19 18:21:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2018-10-22 08:06:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 13692, 'date': '2018-10-22 08:11:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

I liked version with separate logic for 'prefer_next' option, but if most people prefer this one, than meh."}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2018-10-22 09:40:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I now compared neutron-rally-task results for create_and_list ports in Your patch: http://logs.openstack.org/41/611341/5/check/neutron-rally-task/714e6c9/results/report.html.gz#/NeutronNetworks.create_and_list_ports and two others:
http://logs.openstack.org/53/612153/3/check/neutron-rally-task/304ffec/results/report.html.gz#/NeutronNetworks.create_and_list_ports and http://logs.openstack.org/83/606383/7/check/neutron-rally-task/09e6484/results/report.html.gz#/NeutronNetworks.create_and_list_ports

As You can see times in Your patch are much longer - am I misunderstood something here or this patch slowed down creation of ports in fact?'}, {'account_id': 13692, 'date': '2018-10-23 10:27:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

[{'created': '2018-10-17 14:46:35.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Allocate IP address from whole list of available ips

TBD

Change-Id: Id11bd780a7e2c5eb290288b28544956640cf44bb
'}, {'created': '2018-10-18 09:46:14.000000000', 'message': 'Allocate IP address from bigger subset of IPs

Allocation mechanism previously tried to generate
IP address taken from first subset of free IPs.

If there are multiple concurrent port-create requests
those threads fight between themselfs for IPs.

So the solution is to make the allocation window, from
which addresses are randomly taken, to be max as possible.
It prevents DBDeadlockErrors and NeutronDbObjectDuplicateEntries.
It also speedups the whole allocation process.

Some statistics taken from my devstack test for 300 created ports.
Allocation is really slow.

Used command:
for i in {1..300}; do echo port${i};done | parallel -vv -j 30 neutron port-create public --fixed-ip subnet_id=9dd20086-fd37-4e74-8852-e532a41e069d --name {}

Without this patch:
>>> numpy.std(data)
38.85653252187421
>>> numpy.percentile(data, 90)
92.16371776
>>> numpy.percentile(data, 99)
174.667329048
>>> numpy.percentile(data, 50)
29.586086
>>> numpy.min(data)
1.3005738
>>> numpy.max(data)
275.8769221

After applying this patch:
>>> numpy.std(data)
6.643350909534087
>>> numpy.percentile(data, 90)
31.71428038
>>> numpy.percentile(data, 99)
37.62866121
>>> numpy.percentile(data, 50)
23.123787049999997
>>> numpy.min(data)
4.2004371
>>> numpy.max(data)
40.4567599
>>>

It is mutch better and every port was created successfully.

Closes-Bug: #1777968

Change-Id: Id11bd780a7e2c5eb290288b28544956640cf44bb

numbers between 1 to 30.
If there are multiple concurrent port-create requests
those threads fight between themselfs for IPs.

So the solution is to make the allocation window, from
which addresses are randomly taken, to be max as possible.
It will prevent DBDeadlockErrors and NeutronDbObjectDuplicateEntries.
It also speed up the whole allocation process.

For huge subnets (like IPv6) we need to set upper-limit for this
allocation window. Due to this we decided to set 1024 IPs as the
maximum. Without limiting it IPSet generator class will raise an
Exception while creating a list from it for subnets with number
of elements bigger than maxint, or it will take some time to
create for each IP IPAddress object and them make a list of it.

If prefer_next is set - only first available IP will be chosen.

Closes-Bug: #1777968

Change-Id: Id11bd780a7e2c5eb290288b28544956640cf44bb
'}]
commit_message:
Allocate IP address from whole available subset of free IPs

Allocation mechanism previously tried to generate IP
address taken from little subset of free IPs. Maximum
window from which the IP was allocated was draw from
numbers between 1 to 30.
If there are multiple concurrent port-create requests
those threads fight between themselfs for IPs.

So the solution is to make the allocation window, from
which addresses are randomly taken, to be max as possible.
It will prevent DBDeadlockErrors and NeutronDbObjectDuplicateEntries.
It also speed up the whole allocation process.

For huge subnets (like IPv6) we need to set upper-limit for this
allocation window. Due to this we decided to set 1024 IPs as the
maximum. Without limiting it IPSet generator class will raise an
Exception while creating a list from it for subnets with number
of elements bigger than maxint, or it will take some time to
create for each IP IPAddress object and them make a list of it.

If prefer_next is set - only first available IP will be chosen.

Closes-Bug: #1777968

Change-Id: Id11bd780a7e2c5eb290288b28544956640cf44bb

commit_message:
Fixup ipaclient.yaml for python3

This change does two things:
1. it uses print() which is the only supported way of calling print
   in python3 (and still works with python2). This way we avoid the
   following error:

SyntaxError: Missing parentheses in call to 'print'. Did you mean print('...')?

2. It uses the PythonInterpreter variable to choose the python
   interpreter

Tested and we correctly get the right wanted interpreter:
...
fqdn=`echo $data | /usr/bin/python3 -c 'import json,sys;obj=json.load(sys.stdin);print(obj.get("join", {}).get("hostname", ""))'`
...

Change-Id: I6e68664c650d0481a9f0cfd21985434d8c75e1a2
Co-Authored-By: Luca Miccini <lmiccini@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add openssl-perl to overcloud image to provide /etc/pki/CA in TLS setup

This directory is no longer available in CentOS 8 with base openssl package.
Libvirt still has the default to /etc/pki/CA for some TLS settings. Lets add
openssl-perl to get /etc/pki/CA and keep defaults where possible.

Change-Id: I8b50a4c79fca19106d752ad50956164a590e8f38
Related-Bug: #1821139

The appdirs lower constraint of 1.3.0 does not work with isort >=
4.3.5, which references appdirs.system, which wasn't added until
appdirs 1.4.0. Neutron addressed this by increasing the lower
constraint to 1.4.3 [1] so we'll do the same.

[1] 9bfe63cf0786176cd48943d902690198e02fdb70

Change-Id: I5ba07e5504fe786bc7dcb42ef0f43034d5384f6f
"}]
commit_message:
Update appdirs lower constraint

The appdirs lower constraint of 1.3.0 does not work with isort >=
4.3.5, which references appdirs.system, which wasn't added until
appdirs 1.4.0. Neutron addressed this by increasing the lower
constraint to 1.4.3 [1] so we'll do the same.

[1] 9bfe63cf0786176cd48943d902690198e02fdb70

Change-Id: I5ba07e5504fe786bc7dcb42ef0f43034d5384f6f

commit_message:
Add missing variable for container image origin

Magnum allows to use CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX to specify a local
repository from which we can pull container images. This repository
defaults to the upstream one that is specified in the metrics helm
chart.

* This patch allows for the usage of CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX to
correctly configure the pull of the metric-server container image
from the specified repo.
* Updated the documentation for the Images that must be mirrored

Change-Id: Idc315937a82317b76349bbe8466d900d00194953
Signed-off-by: Diogo Guerra <dy090.guerra@gmail.com>

Add metrics-server container need to prefix

Change-Id: I62a94507b819a59cefbf01e1d67dc5e3da537cfb

commit_message:
Use union for list combinations to ensure uniqueness

Rather than adding two lists together then passing them through
the 'unique' filter to remove duplicates, we combine the two
actions by using the union filter.

Change-Id: I8b032f3b5d043e543c1d0fd0434d833385ceecc4

commit_message:
exc_filters: fix deadlock detection for MariaDB/Galera cluster

MariasDB/Galera cluster server produces an error like:

(1213, u'Deadlock: wsrep aborted transaction')

which is currently not detected properly and, thus, not retried.

Change-Id: Ifb4a81d50e490e734e12986e51efd6bd3c339c31

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Change-Id: Ieb0ff6ce51300e1ded939da4df5634e0683ef60a
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Re-enable shell UUID completion cache

This enables writing ids to a local completion
cache when using the cinderclient shell, which
allows tools/cinder.bash_completion to complete
commands such as
    cinder delete a<tab>

Volume ids are recorded on "cinder list" and
"cinder create" operations, similar for backup ids.

This functionality was unintentionally removed in
changes some time ago.  Labeled as Partial-Bug
because I haven't added name caching yet, which also
used to exist.

Partial-Bug: #1712835
Change-Id: Id56aa43b061758a00a2a8c9c92a5a33ab9f7ab84
(cherry picked from commit c4b37c2830fdd90b57383a93e09a8bd40ca41221)

commit_message:
Add toggle for python wheel build process

If a package (like stackviz) should be installed using
a tarball, rather than from a git source, then it is
better to be able to disable the wheel build process,
constraints usage, etc and just install it from the
tarball.

Change-Id: Id1dc504586a3a1bbd7a161b7367606ced3789043

commit_message:
Use the repo if available

Currently a configured pip.conf is required in order to make
use of the repo server in an OSA build. This ensures that it
is used, but not exclusively used, if it is available to source
python packages.

The implementation allows it to still respect any configured pip
configuration on the host, so we should be able to remove the OSA
pip.conf with this in place and still maintain the use of the local
repo.

Change-Id: Ia6f2cf86f77ee380fce2d1ecc89e1cb4341e39df

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ib02316a43b18bdbfee29aa157a7a0438b9b2fdc9

'}, {'created': '2019-02-15 15:23:04.000000000', 'message': 'Apply constraints when building the venv

Currently the role expects all constraints to be applied
in pip arguments provided to the role, which means that
there is some pre-processing required outside the role
for this to happen.

In order to pave the way to replace repo_build with this
role, we need to be able to apply constraints and maintain
idempotency even when building from a git source.

To achieve this we ensure that we build the wheels in a
temporary location, then use the resulting wheels for the
specific service to build a service-specific set of
requirements and constraints. To enable idempotency, we
only rebuild the wheels if the requirements/constraints
change.

We use slurp to collect the constraints and re-implement
them when installing the venv on the target hosts. This
prevents us having to inform the venv build role about
the repo server URL. We may change this at a later date
in order to facilitate a centralised repo server for
multiple regions.

Change-Id: I7c467e3a9e6627b75664b94f6b8e3232975171a7

commit_message:
Apply constraints when building the venv

Currently the role expects all constraints to be applied
in pip arguments provided to the role, which means that
there is some pre-processing required outside the role
for this to happen.

In order to pave the way to replace repo_build with this
role, we need to be able to apply constraints and maintain
idempotency even when building from a git source.

To achieve this we ensure that we build the wheels in a
temporary location, then use the resulting wheels for the
specific service to build a service-specific set of
requirements and constraints. To enable idempotency, we
only rebuild the wheels if the requirements/constraints
change.

We use slurp to collect the constraints and re-implement
them when installing the venv on the target hosts. This
prevents us having to inform the venv build role about
the repo server URL. We may change this at a later date
in order to facilitate a centralised repo server for
multiple regions.

Change-Id: I7c467e3a9e6627b75664b94f6b8e3232975171a7

Update master for stable/stein

stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-22 10:32:52.000000000', 'message': 'Allow console service to read certificate data

The console proxy service run as user ``nova`` throughout its lifespan,
it has no load certificates before dropping privileges mechanism.

Set file permissions on certificate files to support this.

Sync charm helpers.

Closes-Bug: #1819140
Change-Id: I597b82070e51506c56500267daa2b59d8145b9f9
'}]
commit_message:
Allow console service to read certificate data

The console proxy service run as user ``nova`` throughout its lifespan,
it has no load certificates before dropping privileges mechanism.

Set file permissions on certificate files to support this.

Sync charm helpers.

Closes-Bug: #1819140
Change-Id: I597b82070e51506c56500267daa2b59d8145b9f9

[{'created': '2019-03-22 10:32:52.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecate separate configuration options for console TLS

Console TLS will automatically be set up when the Nova API has TLS
enabled, either through configuration (``ssl_*``) or through
certificates relation to vault.

Having multiple knobs to set up the console TLS is not really

commit_message:
Deprecate separate configuration options for console TLS

Console TLS will automatically be set up when the Nova API has TLS
enabled, either through configuration (``ssl_*``) or through
certificates relation to vault.

Having multiple knobs to set up the console TLS is not really
necessary and it adds to complexity.

Change-Id: I6efb72bced8473ad52e623318a51ed976c7ac31c
Related-Bug: #1819140

"}, {'created': '2019-03-21 13:18:53.000000000', 'message': "Fix deployment for Rocky

Ubuntu now allows to choose between python(2)- and python3-based

commit_message:
Fix deployment for Rocky

Ubuntu now allows to choose between python(2)- and python3-based
packages, installing neither variant by default. So we need to choose
and install one version explicitly, since python3-nova still seems to
have some issues with running under uwsgi, let's start with the python2
variant.

Change-Id: Iee78b5f7de885748fd590e339623f6d2f2fb096b

commit_message:
Support oslo_messaging logger debug

Pike onwards defaults to setting oslo_messaging logger
to INFO and we have no way to set it to DEBUG currently.
This patch will set it to DEBUG when debug is enabled.

Also sets glance.debug=True if debug enabled

Change-Id: I9216325f8e96cb9ee06cddbe75cdd15e98fb0827
Closes-Bug: #1817290

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I16918c3bff3c7376b1b10cd75a012508ac5ff693

[{'created': '2019-02-22 11:40:19.000000000', 'message': "Option to specify python version and use package instead of yum.

In rhel8 the python-tripleoclient version changes into python3-
tripleoclient, so to avoid issues with the packages version a
py_ver variable has been added to allow us make use of one
version or the other. Also, do not depend on the yum command, as
in rhel8 there is no importable yum module. We'll use the package
task instead.

Change-Id: I5edf7b63acaa4df15de5b3bacbc7b9cae1e99b5b
"}]
commit_message:
Option to specify python version and use package instead of yum.

In rhel8 the python-tripleoclient version changes into python3-
tripleoclient, so to avoid issues with the packages version a
py_ver variable has been added to allow us make use of one
version or the other. Also, do not depend on the yum command, as
in rhel8 there is no importable yum module. We'll use the package
task instead.

Change-Id: I5edf7b63acaa4df15de5b3bacbc7b9cae1e99b5b

commit_message:
Fix map filter usage with urlsplit

As urlsplit is filter as well, so we need to quote it for applying
to all items. Otherwise 'urlsplit' undefined variable error is raised.

Change-Id: Ie4a51b177fb7f8e28c8c7dfb080960d6734ee21f
Related-Bug: #1820830
Co-Authored-By: Nicolas Bock <nicolasbock@gmail.com>

which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ib46e29cf3e0b2ad4e20f7d1a6a1d018748a3f5cb

commit_message:

nova.policies.base.py define a var 'COMPUTE_API' which
is not used anymore.

commit_message:
Fix SoftwareDeployment on DELETE action

When we specify a sd on delete action, os-collect-config will not
get authentication because we didn't load access_allowed_handlers
after stack enter stack delete phrase. This patch will make sure
we load necessary access_allowed_handlers even if in stack delete
phrase.

Change-Id: I43c1a865f507f7cb7757e26ae5c503ce484ee280
Story: #2004661
Task: #28628

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-21 21:28:13.000000000', 'message': "Remove appdirs lower constraint

The appdirs lower constraint of 1.3.0 does not work with isort >=
4.3.5, which references appdirs.system, which wasn't added until
appdirs 1.4.0. We could bump lower-constraints.txt to reference
appdirs 1.4.0 but it's not clear that we really need to test with
old versions of appdirs... so this just removes the constraint.

Change-Id: I5ba07e5504fe786bc7dcb42ef0f43034d5384f6f
"}, {'created': '2019-03-22 13:18:03.000000000', 'message': "Update appdirs lower constraint

The appdirs lower constraint of 1.3.0 does not work with isort >=
4.3.5, which references appdirs.system, which wasn't added until
appdirs 1.4.0. Neutron addressed this by increasing the lower
constraint to 1.4.3 [1] so we'll do the same.

[1] 9bfe63cf0786176cd48943d902690198e02fdb70

Change-Id: I5ba07e5504fe786bc7dcb42ef0f43034d5384f6f
"}]
commit_message:
Update appdirs lower constraint

The appdirs lower constraint of 1.3.0 does not work with isort >=
4.3.5, which references appdirs.system, which wasn't added until
appdirs 1.4.0. Neutron addressed this by increasing the lower
constraint to 1.4.3 [1] so we'll do the same.

[1] 9bfe63cf0786176cd48943d902690198e02fdb70

Change-Id: I5ba07e5504fe786bc7dcb42ef0f43034d5384f6f

[{'created': '2019-03-22 12:14:07.000000000', 'message': 'Bump minimum psycopg2

The current minimum version of psycopg2 (2.6.2) does not work with
PostgreSQL 10.6. This is fixed [1] with version 2.7 so we are
bumping to that to work with newer PostgreSQL.

[1] https://github.com/psycopg/psycopg2/commit/8b96bcddff99306189152408dc8dd441020fa800

Change-Id: I20bde202791ff02e60362022fea3217081b89e25
(cherry picked from commit b4c08d283f1416bb0b9fb9d10a052dd4c491b90d)
'}]
commit_message:
Bump minimum psycopg2

The current minimum version of psycopg2 (2.6.2) does not work with
PostgreSQL 10.6. This is fixed [1] with version 2.7 so we are
bumping to that to work with newer PostgreSQL.

[1] https://github.com/psycopg/psycopg2/commit/8b96bcddff99306189152408dc8dd441020fa800

Change-Id: I20bde202791ff02e60362022fea3217081b89e25
(cherry picked from commit b4c08d283f1416bb0b9fb9d10a052dd4c491b90d)

commit_message:
zuul: new variable to easily populate TEMPEST_PLUGINS

TEMPEST_PLUGINS contains the list of the tempest plugins installed
alongside tempest by lib/tempest.
If TEMPEST_PLUGINS is not explicitly set, the new tempest_plugins
variable is used to fill it by combining its items with
the base devstack path.

Change-Id: I9f1fa2755e16871ff9d6ba33fdeaf3023eedf8d4

"}, {'created': '2019-03-13 03:57:36.000000000', 'message': "Migrate legacy jobs to Ubuntu Bionic

We have migrated the zuulv3 job to Bionic during Dec/Jan month.
 - http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/000837.html
 - https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/devstack-bionic
But that effort does not move all gate job to Bionic as there are
large amount of jobs are still legacy jobs. All the legacy jobs still
use Xenial as nodeset.

As per the decided runtime for Stein, we need to test everything on openstack
CI/CD on Bionic - https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html

Below patch move the legacy base jobs to bionic which will move the derived jobs
automatically to bionic. These jobs are modified with branch variant so that they will use
Bionic node from stein onwards and xenial for all other stable branches
until stable/rocky.
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639096

This commit remove the overridden nodeset from legacy jobs
so that it will start using the nodeset defined in parent job.

More Details: 
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/legacy-job-bionic
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003614.html

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639096

Don't compile ovs kernel module on Bionic
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/642461/

Change-Id: Idf073eaef3772aa24b60d600cec3f898e6ed022a

commit_message:
Migrate legacy jobs to Ubuntu Bionic

We have migrated the zuulv3 job to Bionic during Dec/Jan month.
 - http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/000837.html
 - https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/devstack-bionic
But that effort does not move all gate job to Bionic as there are
large amount of jobs are still legacy jobs. All the legacy jobs still
use Xenial as nodeset.

As per the decided runtime for Stein, we need to test everything on openstack
CI/CD on Bionic - https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html

Below patch move the legacy base jobs to bionic which will move the derived jobs
automatically to bionic. These jobs are modified with branch variant so that they will use
Bionic node from stein onwards and xenial for all other stable branches
until stable/rocky.
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639096

This commit remove the overridden nodeset from legacy jobs
so that it will start using the nodeset defined in parent job.

More Details:
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/legacy-job-bionic
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003614.html

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639096

Co-Authored-By: Ghanshyam Mann <gmann@ghanshyammann.com>

Change-Id: Idf073eaef3772aa24b60d600cec3f898e6ed022a

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-21 22:32:25.000000000', 'message': 'Don't print commands during yum update

The commands contain package lists, so having "set -x" makes the

Change-Id: I8ffda90eb0633b6b46e29c5af7ed2ff3571c14a2
Related-Bug: #1813684
'}]
commit_message:
Don't print commands during yum update

The commands contain package lists, so having "set -x" makes the
logged result very very verbose.

Change-Id: I8ffda90eb0633b6b46e29c5af7ed2ff3571c14a2
Related-Bug: #1813684

commit_message:
Adds conditional skip excludes in containers build for rocky

The excludes list is needed for f28 containers build. For the
rocky periodic we need to skip it as there is no such parameter
in the container build there.

Instead uses sed to remove excludes from containers list.
Once we cherrypick that [1] we can remove sed and use --excludes.

Test runs in [2]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:cherrypick-excludes-containers-build
[2] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/19533/
Co-Authored-By: Sagi Shnaidman <sshnaidm@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I668a8557165972324e11707c2f3f32199658b6b9

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Iffe52b5f7959851d4da258a7111a2fcfc4901dc4
'}]
commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Iffe52b5f7959851d4da258a7111a2fcfc4901dc4

commit_message:
Adding ironic tests on fs001

In near future we are going to gate ironic project, so updating this
featureset to enable ironic tests.

Change-Id: Ia6314af43b0913775d28c87fee488342f45eef81
DNM: It will run ironic tests anyway!

The current minimum version of psycopg2 (2.6.2) does not work with
PostgreSQL 10.6. This is fixed [1] with version 2.7 so we are
bumping to that to work with newer PostgreSQL.

[1] https://github.com/psycopg/psycopg2/commit/8b96bcddff99306189152408dc8dd441020fa800

Change-Id: I20bde202791ff02e60362022fea3217081b89e25
'}]
commit_message:
Bump minimum psycopg2

The current minimum version of psycopg2 (2.6.2) does not work with
PostgreSQL 10.6. This is fixed [1] with version 2.7 so we are
bumping to that to work with newer PostgreSQL.

[1] https://github.com/psycopg/psycopg2/commit/8b96bcddff99306189152408dc8dd441020fa800

Change-Id: I20bde202791ff02e60362022fea3217081b89e25

commit_message:
Place upper bound on python-dracclient version

The idrac hardware type requires python-dracclient versions greater than
or equal to 1.5.0 and less than 3.0.0 for releases off of stable/stein.

Change-Id: I22dc19f6e2a5e47fcfe5ac70bbff10cc63e14f5f

[{'created': '2019-03-22 02:39:08.000000000', 'message': 'Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I59312b9ee70b4a3a7e9912a011de770d8df0f5a4
'}]
commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I59312b9ee70b4a3a7e9912a011de770d8df0f5a4

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-14 05:36:19.000000000', 'message': "Fix : sort variables fetched from env list

In bionic, when exporting env variables, the env list displays
variables in unsorted format.
While fetching we are getting 'https_proxy' before 'http_proxy'
which is failing in comparison to our expected values[1].
This patch sorts the variables fetched from env.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/30/643130/3/check/devstack-unit-tests/effbf7a/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-03-13_23_12_35_465026

Change-Id: Ie504eabf0d3fec1b97bc711e2702c06bcf75d158
"}]
commit_message:
Fix : sort variables fetched from env list

In bionic, when exporting env variables, the env list displays
variables in unsorted format.
While fetching we are getting 'https_proxy' before 'http_proxy'
which is failing in comparison to our expected values[1].
This patch sorts the variables fetched from env.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/30/643130/3/check/devstack-unit-tests/effbf7a/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-03-13_23_12_35_465026

Change-Id: Ie504eabf0d3fec1b97bc711e2702c06bcf75d158

commit_message:
Update test-requirements for stable/stein

Update the URL to the ceilometer test-requirements file to point to
the stable/stein branch.

The build-err.log e.g. [1] contains a lot more than just

commit_message:
WIP Improve log output from buildcontainers jobs

The build-err.log e.g. [1] contains a lot more than just
errors even when job is successful

The build.log seems to only capture the output from the
build and nothing else e.g. [2]. Trying append and changing
the order

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/03/638403/3/check/tripleo-build-containers-centos-7/f38be54/logs/build-err.log.txt.gz
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/03/638403/3/check/tripleo-build-containers-centos-7/f38be54/logs/build.log.txt.gz

Change-Id: I9c3fc99610ea87011a425483cf884b990a87f579

commit_message:
Enable configuration of ca_file and crl_file for nova live migration

These options are for libvirt's configuration file; and allow us to use
custom paths for these parameters, instead of relying on the default
ones.

Related-Bug: #1821139
Change-Id: I208bb53c2a270d770d114116fde3f062c0d66985

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ib0e286b4bc8705befcb20b1f150667cc8ee4a100

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I90f3a23320da7e90b45732707ee4c3c35446dd3b

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-22 09:26:36.000000000', 'message': 'Use the stable/stein branch for dependencies

After the cut of a bifrost stable branch, it is necessary to modify the
default branch used to install dependencies to stable/stein. We also
use the stein tinyipa ramdisk and kernel image artifacts.

Change-Id: Ic28958e46783086e89b04e405518504a49725155
'}]
commit_message:
Use the stable/stein branch for dependencies

After the cut of a bifrost stable branch, it is necessary to modify the
default branch used to install dependencies to stable/stein. We also
use the stein tinyipa ramdisk and kernel image artifacts.

Change-Id: Ic28958e46783086e89b04e405518504a49725155

Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Beautify Generate test-list file shell task

Currently  Generate test-list file shell task is wrapped in a
single long script with jinja template which makes it hard to
read and it also leads to cause jinja issue, breaking it into
multiple lines improves it.

Change-Id: I17dd53dc583d75a3a19019ba4d7eac8be7077338

Could you please propose this change to the master branch first, then we can backport it to stable branches."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-03-21 14:29:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Thanks for this.
 > 
 > It's strange that we don't see issues when building in CI.
 > 
 > Could you please propose this change to the master branch first,

Spoke too soon - I am seeing this on stable branches, but not master where the code is a little different. There is another fix we need to apply at the same time, so I'll fix that up."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-03-21 14:35:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
rabbitmq container error.

The response code is 301 when get the rabbitmq_clusterer-3.6.x-667f92b0.ez with curl.
The rabbitmq source has changed http to https.

Change-Id: Ic0c4ad01607794f44a61448b002885cb33efea98

[{'created': '2019-03-19 15:15:15.000000000', 'message': 'Address old TODO in claim_resources_on_destination

This removes some old comments about how things worked
prior to Pike where the ResourceTracker would "heal"
allocations on the compute node during the periodic
update_available_resource task. That code was removed
via change I39d93dbf8552605e34b9f146e3613e6af62a1774 (Rocky).

Instead of logging a warning, ConsumerAllocationRetrievalFailed
is now raised since without the instance consumer allocations
on the source node during a forced evacuate we cannot proceed

live migration or evacuate operation with a forced target host
and evacuate is the only case where source_allocations are not
provided.

'}, {'created': '2019-03-19 22:34:01.000000000', 'message': 'Address old TODO in claim_resources_on_destination

The TODO at the end of the method was based on some old
nova-compute behavior which was removed with change
I39d93dbf8552605e34b9f146e3613e6af62a1774 in Rocky.

commit_message:
Address old TODO in claim_resources_on_destination

The TODO at the end of the method was based on some old
nova-compute behavior which was removed with change
I39d93dbf8552605e34b9f146e3613e6af62a1774 in Rocky.

Instead of logging a warning, ConsumerAllocationRetrievalFailed
is now raised since without the instance consumer allocations
on the source node during a forced evacuate we cannot proceed
with making those allocations on the destination host.

The method is refactored a bit for clarity while in here and
to drop the big nesting.

Remember that this method is *only* called in the case of a
live migration or evacuate operation with a forced target host
and evacuate is the only case where source_allocations are not
provided.

Change-Id: I988d1bd4d7eb1a01d443e3d93964bd09afcc4929

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-19 13:50:20.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanup comments around claim_resources method

This removes some old comments about how things worked
prior to Pike where the ResourceTracker would "heal"
allocations on the compute node during the periodic
update_available_resource task. That code was removed
via change I39d93dbf8552605e34b9f146e3613e6af62a1774 (Rocky)
and change If272365e58a583e2831a15a5c2abad2d77921729 (Stein).

There are also old comments in here about not using claim_resources
during forced live migrate and evacuate and instead call the
scheduler with a hint to skip filters, but that hasn't happened yet
so the "In Queens" portion is just removed since it's misleading
(and somewhat embarrassing at this point that it's not fixed yet).

Finally, the NOTE above claim_resources() which says it's only called
in two places is updated since it's actually called in three places
since it's also used in the forced evacuate destination case.

A follow up change will deal with the TODO about erroring out in the
final else case in claim_resources_on_destination().

Change-Id: I1822ac911ed8dbbb482fd4c13591d86b0c518321
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup comments around claim_resources method

This removes some old comments about how things worked
prior to Pike where the ResourceTracker would "heal"
allocations on the compute node during the periodic
update_available_resource task. That code was removed
via change I39d93dbf8552605e34b9f146e3613e6af62a1774 (Rocky)
and change If272365e58a583e2831a15a5c2abad2d77921729 (Stein).

There are also old comments in here about not using claim_resources
during forced live migrate and evacuate and instead call the
scheduler with a hint to skip filters, but that hasn't happened yet
so the "In Queens" portion is just removed since it's misleading
(and somewhat embarrassing at this point that it's not fixed yet).

Finally, the NOTE above claim_resources() which says it's only called
in two places is updated since it's actually called in three places
since it's also used in the forced evacuate destination case.

A follow up change will deal with the TODO about erroring out in the
final else case in claim_resources_on_destination().

Change-Id: I1822ac911ed8dbbb482fd4c13591d86b0c518321

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Change-Id: I5aa55d9077715c5c6c6c0ef36768f5a270a3df2a
Sem-Ver: feature

I think this is good progress, and I know we talked in IRC, but thought I would drop the comments in here for everyone else.

1.) I think we need to expose this for all of the daemons.
2.) I also agree that this should be always on
3.) I noticed in doing a dump of the object-replicator on my saio that it showed all of the green threads in the guru function, which is probably not what the person really wants to see."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2014-02-27 06:03:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

See:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GuruMeditationReport
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo/+spec/guru-meditation-report
